speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: Spatial cognition, I should first say, is a very important problem.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: The primary task of any animal brain is to control its movements, physical movements, its limbs, in 3D.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: And that's a 3D problem.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: And it has to do that at all times of the day.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: And we believe, being Bayesians, that they do this by building and using Bayesian maximum likelihood model of three-dimensional space

text: But the particular 3D model of space, that's been important since the Cambrian era, when animals first started having precise sense data, like good eyes and capable limbs.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: And there's been huge and sustained selection pressure on all animal species since then to do it well.
speaker: SPEAKER_01

text: So that must be quite a good model of space in our heads.
